meanings.definition: A comb-like structure on the legs of certain arthropods, used for grooming and sensing.
meanings.sent1: The pectines on the scorpion's legs help it to sense its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: She observed the pectines on the spider's legs as it cleaned itself meticulously.
meanings.sent3: The curious ant tried to use its pectines as a tiny comb to groom its tiny antennae.
meanings.sent4: The pectines of the beetle moved gracefully, like dancers on the legs.
meanings.sent5: The scientist marveled at the intricate design of the pectines under the microscope.

meanings.definition: A sensory organ in certain insects, located on the tarsi of the legs.
meanings.sent1: The pectines on the cricket's legs help it to detect vibrations in the ground.
meanings.sent2: The entomologist studied the pectines of the grasshopper to understand its sensory capabilities.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fly pretended its pectines were antennas, trying to tune in to insect radio stations.
meanings.sent4: The pectines of the butterfly fluttered gently, sensing the sweet scent of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The young bug enthusiast eagerly pointed out the pectines on the beetle's legs to her friends.
